channel.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
channel.description: I am currently coding a 317 Delta base server. I have downloaded an autospawn.cfg that spawns all of the NPCs in Varrock and Lumbridge. The autospawn.cfg has all the codes to let the NPCs walk in the perfect places so they wont clip through walls and stuff. But only the NPCs in Varrock move. When i went to go check on the NPCs in Lumbridge, they were just standing there not moving at all. [b]How do i allow the NPCs to walk? [/b] i double checked the code and compiled to make sure they were working properly. But nothing has seemed to work yet!

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @teh_war_of_noobs teh war of noobs
item.description:
@teh_war_of_noobs wrote:

lol yeah thanks for your help x)

Read full topic

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

LOL. As I stated, I don’t use Delta. 2 is usually the best walkType to use in any other server. At least you solved something on your own.

Read full topic

item.description:
@teh_war_of_noobs wrote:

my autospawn is 12.4kb. i stuck to the old autospawn and

I FIXED IT, all i had to do was change the 2’s to 1’s.

SO FROM THIS:

To THIS:

Read full topic

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

19687 is too big of a number, especially if it’s an NPCID. Your .cfg file can be as big as you like, I’m sure you are no where near too big. My NPCDefinitions.xml file is 300mb.

Find that number in the file and see why it’s there.

Read full topic

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @teh_war_of_noobs teh war of noobs
item.description:
@teh_war_of_noobs wrote:

yeah. and i just downloaded a new autospawn.cfg, i think it is too big of a file. is there any way i can make 2 autospawn.cfgs?
here is the error:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 19687 at NPCHandler.newNPC(NPCHandler.java:2204) at NPCHandler.loadAutoSpawn(NPCHandler.java:1970) at NPCHandler.<init>(NPCHandler.java:551) at server.main(server.java:111)

Read full topic

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Wait a while, sometimes they take 30 seconds because they are lazy. If not, Delta is gay and only lets you use X+6, Y+6, X-6, Y-6 etc.

As I said, Delta is not a very good source to use, despite people telling you to use it if you are a beginner.

Read full topic

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @teh_war_of_noobs teh war of noobs
item.description:
@teh_war_of_noobs wrote:

Done, and there was no error this time. But the NPC still does not move.

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Remove all spacing in between 3218 and 2 and press tab. In fact, remove all spacing and tab between all numbers just to make sure.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @teh_war_of_noobs teh war of noobs

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "2 3235 3219 0 3236 3220 3234 3218 2 Man" at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at NPCHandler.loadAutoSpawn(NPCHandler.java:1970) at NPCHandler.<init>(NPCHandler.java:551) at server.main(server.java:111)

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

I see, yours would be ID X Y H X+1 Y+1 X-1 Y-1 2 NAME

So for that Man you done earlier, use:

spawn = 2 3235 3219 0 3236 3220 3234 3218 2 Man

Read full topic

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Post an NPC that does work (you said Varrock NPCs walked around). In most servers it’s ID, X, Y, H, X-1, Y-1, X+1,Y+1, WALK, NAME. Delta might be the other way round. X+1 first…

Read full topic

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

If the X and Y spawn coordinates are 2681 and 3325. X-1 means 2680, because it’s -1 of the X coordinate. Sorry I didn’t explain it a bit better.

Read full topic

item.description:

spawn = NPCID X Y HEIGHT X-1 Y-1 X+1 Y+1 2 NAME

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

You have the ranges the wrong way round The first set should be - spawn coords and the second set + spawn coords. Just use -1/+1 to keep it simple.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape

@oldschool-scape wrote:

u dont need to compile for .cfg files

Read full topic

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Do the NPCs have the walkType 2, and have rangeX and rangeY -1/+1 of the spawnX/spawnY coordinates respectively? For example: the first rangeX and rangeY should be -1 of the X/Y coordinates, and the second set of rangeX/Y should be +1.

This creates a box 1 tile in each direction for it to walk around in.

Read full topic

item.title: [317 Delta] NPCs
item.dc:creator: @teh_war_of_noobs teh war of noobs
item.description:
